resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

efiop commented on issue #4907: ARROW-5989: [C++] accommodate openjdk-8 path search prefix
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4907#issuecomment-513188514
 
 
   Thanks for the heads up @kuo ! Created the issue and formatted the PR header. Please take a look. I also see that 2 workers failed in https://travis-ci.org/apache/arrow/builds/560726427utm_source=github_status&utm_medium=notification, but it doesn't seem to be related to my patch. Or is it?

emkornfield commented on issue #4907: ARROW-5989: [C++] accommodate openjdk-8 path search prefix
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4907#issuecomment-513437914
 
 
   It looks like you have a lint error:
   /home/travis/build/apache/arrow/cpp/src/arrow/io/hdfs-internal.cc:166:  Line ends in whitespace.  Consider deleting these extra spaces. 
   
   "make format" or "ninja format" should fix this.

efiop commented on issue #4907: ARROW-5989: [C++] Accommodate openjdk-8 path search prefix
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4907#issuecomment-513508612
 
 
   Thank you @kou ! Sorry for bothering, but when can we expect a new release with this patch? openjdk-8 has been around for quite a while, and without this patch it is quite hard to use pyarrow on ubuntu, especially for unsuspecting users of projects that use pyarrow as a dependency. 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

efiop commented on issue #4907: ARROW-5989: [C++] Accommodate openjdk-8 path search prefix
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4907#issuecomment-513508612
 
 
   Thank you @kou ! Sorry for bothering, but when can we expect a new release with this patch? openjdk-8 has been around for quite a while, and without this patch it is quite hard to use pyarrow on ubuntu, especially for unsuspecting users of projects that use pyarrow as a dependency. 
   
   EDIT: looks like 0.14.1 has been released a few days ago, but it is not available on pypi. Not sure if I'm asking at the right place, since the question is about pyarrow release :confused: 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

kou commented on issue #4907: ARROW-5989: [C++] Accommodate openjdk-8 path search prefix
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4907#issuecomment-513510346
 
 
   0.14.1 isn't released yet. It's just RC for now.
   It'll be released in a few days.
   
   This patch will be included into the next release after 0.14.1. It'll be occurred in a few months.
   
   You will be able to `JAVA_HOME` environment variable until this patch is included into our release.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: Getting `pyarrow.lib.ArrowIOError: Unable to load libjvm ` when trying to connect to hdfs using pyarrow with openjdk-8 installed. Fix available here [https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4907]
fields.summary: [C++][Python] pyarrow.lib.ArrowIOError: Unable to load libjvm when using openjdk-8
